−
'''Love''' has several different meanings in the [[English (language)|English]] language, from something that gives a little pleasure ("I loved that meal") to something one would die for ([[patriotism]], [[pair-bonding]]). It can describe an intense feeling of [[affection]], an [[emotion]] or an emotional state. In ordinary use, it usually refers to interpersonal love. In colloquial use, according to polled opinion, the most favored definitions of ''love'' include the words:{{ref|love-poll}}
+
'''Love''' has several different meanings in the [[English (language)|English]] language, from something that gives a little pleasure ("I loved that meal") to something one would die for ([[patriotism]], [[pair-bonding]]). It can describe an intense feeling of [[affection]], an [[emotion]] or an emotional state. In ordinary use, it usually refers to interpersonal love. Dictionaries tend to define ''love'' as deep affection or fondness.{{ref|dictionary}} In colloquial use, according to polled opinion, the most favored definitions of ''love'' include the words:{{ref|love-poll}}
     
#'''[[life]]''' - someone or something you would give your life for.
